article.headline: Pennsylvania 69, Columbia 43
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Ibrahim Jaaber scored 17 points, Brian Grandieri added 14 and Penn rolled to a 69-43 victory over Columbia on Saturday night. Jaaber had 11 points in the first half, including six in an 11-4 run that put Penn in front 32-21 with 2:31 left before the half. Jaaber hit a 3-point shot and later converted a 3-point play off a lay-up during the run. Grandieri sank a 40-foot shot at the buzzer to give the Quakers (9-6, 2-0 Ivy) a 37-23 halftime lead. Columbia (10-6, 1-1) got no closer than 16 in the second half and scored only one field goal in the game's final 10 minutes. Ben Nwachukwu led the Lions with 15 points and John Baumann had 10. Mark Zoller scored 11 for the Quakers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
